_source.text: A brain hemorrhage following a water-skiing accident inspired IRM, but references to the accident are mostly oblique-all the better, since the random horror-movie stingers and ping-ponging percussion of a track like "Vanities" evoke someone's last day on Earth better than anything so frank as a lyric.

text: are mostly oblique-all the better, since the **random** **horror**-movie stingers and ping-ponging percussion
of a track like "Vanities" evoke someone's last day on Earth **better** **than** anything so frank as a lyric.

_source.text: [ 28 ] Rene Rodriguez of The Miami Herald thought that the film devolved into a guessing game of who would survive, though he praised Marshall's "nightmare imagery" for generating scares that work better than other horror films.

text: who would survive, though he praised Marshall's "**nightmare** imagery" for generating scares that work **better** **than** other **horror** films.
